nf-core/createpanelrefs

Generate Panel of Normals, models, and reference resources from multiple samples

Overview

This bioinformatics helper pipeline creates panel of normals and other models essential for variant calling and CNV analysis. The pipeline supports multiple tools and is designed for whole genome (WGS) and whole exome (WES) sequencing data.

Key Features

  • Read Quality Control: FastQC analysis for input quality assessment
  • Multiple Tool Support: Build Panel of Normals for CNVKIT, GATK's germlinecnvcaller, GENS, and Mutect2
  • Flexible Configuration: Supports custom FASTA files, interval lists, and target region specifications
  • Comprehensive Reporting: MultiQC reports with pipeline performance metrics and statistics

Supported Tools

  • GATK Germline CNV Caller: Generates contig ploidy models and CNV caller models with read count statistics
  • CNVkit: Creates reference panels for copy number variation detection
  • GENS: Produces read count data in HDF5 and TSV formats with panel of normals
  • Mutect2: Builds somatic variant calling Panel of Normals with genomic database workspaces

Input Requirements

You need to provide a samplesheet (CSV or TSV format) with information about the samples. The pipeline will auto-detect whether samples are aligned in BAM or CRAM format.

Output Files

  • Contig ploidy models and CNV caller models
  • Panel of normals VCF files
  • Read count data and statistics
  • MultiQC HTML report with parsed statistics and plots
  • Pipeline execution reports and software version tracking

Pipeline Information

Version: Development (dev branch)
Nextflow Required: 24.10.5 or higher
Template: nf-core 3.3.2

Documentation: https://nf-co.re/createpanelrefs
